task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 97°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the building (especially the roofline) to estimate height, so I should tilt the camera upward while staying oriented east.
The heading is now north at a steep upward pitch, so I should rotate right to face east again while keeping the elevated view to capture the roofline.
To estimate height I need the roof and overall facade in view, so I should tilt up while staying aimed at the building to the east.
The view has snapped back to north again, so I should rotate right to return to facing east while maintaining the upward pitch for a full-height estimate.
I keep losing the pitched-up view, so I’ll stay facing east and stop to provide a reasonable height estimate based on a typical 3–4 story main building scale.
